alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Carroll; Cherokee; Cobb; Douglas; Forsyth; North Fulton; Paulding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 2:58PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Paulding, Cherokee, western Forsyth, Cobb, north central Carroll, northwestern Douglas, northeastern Fulton and southeastern Bartow Counties through 330 PM EST... At 258 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Canton to near Dallas, and moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, pea sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Canton, Dallas, Cumming, Mountain Park, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Alpharetta, Smyrna, Dunwoody, Milton, Kennesaw, Woodstock, Acworth, Powder Springs, Holly Springs, Austell, Hiram, Emerson and Free Home. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EST for north central and northwestern Georgia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 700 PM EST for north central and northwestern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Bartow; Carroll; Cherokee; Cobb; Douglas; Forsyth; North Fulton; Paulding
